intro: Illicium san-ki, commonly known as star anise, is a flowering plant native to southern China, Vietnam, and other parts of East Asia. It belongs to the family Schisandraceae and is characterized by its aromatic, star-shaped fruit that resembles a tiny star. The fruit contains essential oils, particularly shikimic acid, which is widely used in the production of pharmaceuticals and flavorings. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and can reach heights of up to 10 meters. Its botanical features make it an important species in both traditional medicine and modern industry.
